metadata.title: What Is the State of the Non-measurement Terminal Pin?

sections.content:
Question:
When a sensor (TS pin) is being scanned, what is the state of the adjacent TS pin (Hi-Z or Low/High signal or GND)?
Answer:
The standard F/W of QE for Capacitive Touch requires the user to set as needed.
It is recommended that the TS pin not used in the application be set to GPIO Low output for noise suppression.
When using active shield, set to "In-phase pulse output," a setting that outputs the shield signal in-phase with the sensor drive pulse, in order to shield external influences while suppressing the increase of parasitic capacitance.
Suitable Products
RX113
RX130
RX231, RX230
